hang in there it gets better it going to get better there are several things going on here day is commonly when milk comes fully in after section day is typically growth spurt time for newborns when they want to eat all the time and wo be put down have you seen lactation consultant to make sure he latching and sucking well do you hear him swallow when he nurses has he started to gain weight do you have any help at home are your breasts feeling fuller or exhibiting other signs of your mature milk coming in these are the things would ask you if you were my client postpartum doula most urgent need for you right now though is sleep urge you to find someone who can come over and hold the baby for you for solid hours so you can start getting some restorative sleep feed him right before you lie down but make sure that your support person *does not disturb you* during your nap baby might fuss but he wo starve during one hour period your body ca recover from surgery and make plentiful milk if you are this horrifically sleep deprived do this every day and have your husband do it at least once every night assuming he at work right now and when you wake up try calling local postpartum he was gaining weight at good rate but was getting blisters on my nipples so knew he was latching properly all you can really do is reposition them if you feel pain try pulling his chin down gently with your thumb with one hand while inserting your nipple with the other the hand on the nipple should gently squeeze it to flatten the height of the areola down it gets so much better promise hang in better we are still going at 18 months it sounds more like the baby keeps wanting to nurse because they are newborn and that the way newborns are to be honest babies that young feed little and often their stomachs are tiny and it also their main source of comfort frequent nursing in the early days is also how supply is established stop trying to scare her over something that more likely than not totally normal phase of development ve never heard that phrase for it but my mum said that for all of us on day for she was super teary it is maybe possible but there no reason to think this is at all likely it called cluster feeding and it really common but are you in any way qualified to work out what is up if she gives you her diet what makes you able to tell if it appropriate for breastfeeding mother or are you just coming in and taking shot in the dark based on no info because if that the case that is very patronising second that there is usually cluster feeding at about days have you thought about side lying nursing it was life saver for me once figured it out it tough but it gets better but maybe try to do something for yourself too can someone hold baby for you so you can take shower if you re up to it or have glass of coffee tea also suggest looking for la leche league that local we have bunch of free breastfeeding resources in des moines maybe you have something similar son october 18th he now few days shy of months couple things got section too had to because had an infection my healing time was great though and in the end was happy it happened think it was the infection that caused my low milk supply and looking back was drinking lot of water those first couple weeks felt like was in the twilight zone he was huge at birth 10 pounds oz but he kept losing weight took fenugreek and blessed thistle was on domperidon as well and nothing worked started supplementing bit at month and after awhile could handle his hunger and seeing him drop weight so at weeks went to all formula felt super guilty for long time that stopped breastfeeding was obnoxious and was sure would have no problems and felt like less of mother when quit but he started thriving and he now weights 19 pounds the fact of the matter is if you get to that desperate point you have to do what best for you because by helping yourself you are also helping your baby quick story my grandmother lost her first baby in the 40s she went full term and ended up getting toxemia the baby died at birth when my grandmother went into coma for couple days sorry for such horrible intro but she had cousin who had had baby about month or so before her she thought the baby was just fussy baby but the baby ended up dying as well around the same time my grandmother did he died of starvation at that time there was no help after you had the baby and people did know you could get low supplies this is why they make formula not because if you supplement or solely feed formula you are bad mother but because babies would starve without it sometimes fed is best and so it your mental health do what best for you seriously it will get so much easier and about the side feeding would worry too much if your unable to right now my daughter is now amp months and she just started latching in that position which makes it easier it hard right now but once you hit those weeks you ll realize how special the bonding is between you and your baby also the fact that your giving him the healthiest form of food is great feeling so thankful stuck to it especially thinking how you do have to worry about getting up to warm up bottle in the middle of the night you ll actually end up getting more sleep than bottle fed babies since you ll be able to just pop boob out just close your eyes and
